characters.name: Rahamat
characters.abilityDescription: Doubles the number of Virtues gain at the end of the game
characters.description: Rahamat, the Kabuliwallah, is an Afghan peddler working in India to support his family back home. His bond with Mini, a young Indian girl who reminds him of his daughter, underscores the sacrifices and emotional connections of immigrants separated from loved ones.

characters.name: Maheen Banou
characters.abilityDescription: Her troublesome situation, increases the difficulty of the present battle by 3
characters.description: An elder facing constant displacement, Maheen Banou yearns for peace and stability. Her story explores the universal desire for security in life’s later stages, reflecting the resilience and wisdom she’s gathered over the years as she navigates these challenges.
characters.origin: A Mansion in the Sky by Goli Taraghi

characters.name: Ana
characters.description: A housewife, Ana, represents the universal experience of adulthood’s challenges and self-discoveries. She is a character defined by her moments of personal reflection and growth, showing wisdom gained through a journey of introspection, often arriving at life-changing realizations

characters.name: Meno
characters.abilityDescription: His constant assumptions consumes the player’s XP and in return, gives players 5 Virtues
characters.description: A young Greek student from Plato’s Meno, Meno grapples with the elusive concept of virtue, often stumbling into contradictions. His frustration with philosophical inquiry, disrupts his curiosity and openness to learning

characters.name: Bisclavret
characters.abilityDescription: In his beastly form, he strikes fear, lowering enemy's health by 20% permenently
characters.description: The knight Bisclavret is cursed to live as a werewolf, leading a life torn between his human and beastly forms. Highlighting themes of loyalty and betrayal, as he strives to maintain his honor despite the isolation and secrecy that come with his curse.

characters.name: Lady of Laüstic
characters.abilityDescription: Her hope increases allies base damage by 20%
characters.description: A noblewoman trapped in an unfulfilled marriage, the Lady of Laüstic finds solace in her secret love, represented by a nightingale. She uses the nightingale’s song to connect with her lover, symbolizing her unspoken desires and the tragedy of unfulfilled love.

characters.name: Yonec
characters.abilityDescription: Born to avanger, he deals a massive amount of damage to a single enemy (200 Damage)
characters.description: Yonec, the son of a mystical knight and a noblewoman, grows up destined to avenge his parents. He eventually kills the oppressive lord responsible for his parents’ suffering, fulfilling the legacy of his father, a knight who could transform into a hawk.

characters.name: ZhuangZhou
characters.abilityDescription: The dream-like state pauses the timer for 3 seconds
characters.description: The philosopher Zhuang Zhou is famed for his allegory of the butterfly dream, where he questions if he is a man dreaming of a butterfly or a butterfly dreaming of a man. Reflecting deep philosophical themes of illusion, reality, and identity, exploring the fluid nature of existence and perception.

characters.name: Robin
characters.abilityDescription: Transforms enemies into an “Ass” which in turn lowers their maximum health points and total defence.
characters.description: Robin Goodfellow, is a mischievous fairy who serves Oberon, the fairy king. Known for his chaotic tricks, the unpredictable side of the fairy world, often leading to unintended consequences in the human realm.
characters.origin: A Midsummer Night’s Dream by William Shakespeare

characters.name: Socrates
characters.abilityDescription: Confuses enemies which stalls the battle, increasing the amount of time given and giving the player extra XP .
characters.description: The Greek philosopher Socrates is renowned for his method of inquiry, where he challenges others to think critically by asking probing questions. His dialogues are rooted in the pursuit of wisdom, encouraging others to question their beliefs, and he remains an influential figure in philosophy.
